interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: 10th Kingdom - The Epic Miniseries Event
Review Date: 2014/03/21
Store: Kimberly Williams-Paisley  (Actor),     Scott Cohen  (Actor),     David Carson  (Director),     Herbert Wise  (Director)    &                   1                  more   Rated:    PG    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Science Fiction & Fantasy, Fantasy
Product Description: ['Two Worlds Come Together In One Fantastic Adventure!', 'A Magical Epic Adventure The Whole Family Will Enjoy!', 'Trust me...when you join us in The 10th Kingdom, you ll find fantasy and action and romance and adventure. It s a spectacular place to come and play.', 'Camryn Manheim', 'Join an all-star cast as they find fantasy, action, romance and adventure in the Emmy winning®', 'The 10th Kingdom', '! Beyond the mortal world lies Nine Kingdoms where the fantastic land of fairy tales and magic are brought to life and reinvented. The themes and ideas of folklore and mythology perform fully as the classic characters enter a vortex at the edge of the mortal world which leads them to', 'The 10th Kingdom', '...Central Park!', 'This ten part mini-series tells the tale of Prince Wendell (Daniel Lapaine) and the evil queen (Dianne Wiest) who has doomed him to spend the rest of his life as a dog. In order to recapture the throne Prince Wendell travels through the portal to the mythical kingdom of Manhattan and finds two ordinary mortals Virginia (Kimberly Williams-Paisley) and Tony (John Larroquette). Together they battle the evils of the parallel universe, and defend themselves from vile trolls, goblins and every fairy tale character imaginable! Stunning visual effects and a stellar cast create an epic adventure that will enchant audiences of all ages!', 'An all-star cast featuring a wealth of Emmy®, Oscar®, and Golden Globe®-wining and nominated talent including : John Larroquette (', 'Boston Legal', ',', 'The Practice), Kimberly Williams-Paisley (Nashville', ',', 'Father of the Bride), Scott Cohen (Love and Other Drugs', ',', 'Jacob s Ladder), Ann-Margret (Bye Bye Birdie', ',', 'Tommy), Rutger Hauer (Batman Begins', ',', 'Sin City), Daniel Lapaine (', 'Double Jeopardy), Camryn Manheim (', 'The Practice', '), Ed O Neil (', 'Modern Family', ',', 'Married with Children) and Dianne Wiest (Edward Scissorhands', ',', 'Parenthood', ')']
Average Rating: 4.8
Product Details: {'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 7.52 Ounces', 'Item model number': '4098520982', 'Director': 'David Carson, Herbert Wise', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Box set, Full Screen, Color, NTSC, Surround Sound', 'Run time': '7 hours and 27 minutes', 'Release date': 'March 12, 2013', 'Actors': 'Kimberly Williams-Paisley, Scott Cohen, John Larroquette, Dianne Wiest, Camryn Manheim', 'Studio': 'Mill Creek Ent', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: I love the 10th Kingdom miniseries.  When I saw it at this low price I bought it for a friend.  I had purchased it for myself many years ago and paid $30.00 for the set.  Hours of good entertainment.
Review Title: One of my favorite stories
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------

Love Leslie Nielsen.  His silly slap-stick comedy always makes me laugh and Dracula: Dead and Loving it is one of my favorites.
Comedy as only Leslie Nielsen can

profile:
**User Profile Summary:**

- **Comedy Preference:** Strong preference for classic slapstick and humorous content, particularly valuing the comedic style of Leslie Nielsen.
- **Entertainment Themes:** Enjoys films that incorporate elements of violence, frightening scenes, and adult humor (foul language, sexual content) but has also engaged with family-friendly fantasy series, indicating a diverse taste in genre.
- **Artistic Appreciation:** Has an appreciation for the work of notable directors and producers known for comedic and fantasy films, demonstrating an interest in specific industry figures (e.g., Mel Brooks).
- **Language Preference:** Prefers content available in English, including audio descriptions for enhanced accessibility.
- **Rating Trends:** Generally leans towards high ratings, with an average near 4.7, suggesting consistent positive evaluations of entertainment consumed, including family-friendly content rated above 4.8.
- **Subtitles and Accessibility:** Shows a clear inclination towards content with subtitle options, indicating a preference for detailed engagement with the material.

Overall, the user exhibits an affinity for classic comedies and engaging fantasy narratives that entertain a broad audience, alongside a commitment to accessibility and high-quality content evaluation. Their recent interaction reflects a willingness to invest in varied genres while maintaining a preference for quality storytelling.
